title: Make Strut immune to deactivation for a while after Miss Fortune activates W.
body:
Now it goes from being a pathetic joke to something that will actually have some use.


Was that so hard?


**edit:** How in the bloody hell can a thread have only 4 posts, but 30 upvotes?

replies.body: Just make her strut immune to minions. Riot please.

> [{quoted}](name=ToxicPrint,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-10T01:05:12.052+0000)
>
> Just make her strut immune to minions. Riot please.

YES PLZ OMG SO FREAKING ANNOYING TO HAVE IT CANCELED BY MINION
its already been found that any shield that blocks damage will make it so her strut wont fall off in the PBE. That includes {{item:3072}}  shield.
That might be a bug that riot have yet to notice, though that's really helpful if it's not :)

That's mentioned in the update preview, although they only give it one line: "...the updated Strut means shields will keep her passive up when fleeing or engaging..."

Seems like that could combo well with Janna, seeing as you already get bonus movespeed moving towards her anyway.

I think it may or may not have been quickly glanced over in the preview.

In this case, W could give a tiny damage shield, enough to let her Strut be maintained for a bit. Of course it seems odd that someone like her would get a damage shield...


Again though, hardly worthwhile compared to the loss in GW. It both damaged her dueling abilities and took away a lot of her strong match-ups. And the fact that Summoner Heal is already such a common spell makes this even worse.

I actually had an idea where during the time Impure Shots is active, Miss Fortune's Strut ramp up will reset back down to 25 instead of immediately going on cooldown, meaning enemies can still stick to her but she can still stick to you.
trivia: MF's passive originally didn't get removed when the damage was shielded.

> [{quoted}](name=ToxicPrint,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-10T01:05:12.052+0000)
>
> Just make her strut immune to minions. Riot please.

Riot games: Where we change everything but what's actually the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=ToxicPrint,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-10T01:05:12.052+0000)
>
> Just make her strut immune to minions. Riot please.

This. Garen doesn't lose his passive because of minions, why is this inconsistent between champions?
Wouldnt that make her too strong in lane? She will outrade you with the 50% attack speed and if you try to back off she will still get in some nice dps with her move speed.

1. The number of champions she can even outtrade kinda got cut down a bit with her GW taken out. Believe it or not, it made a helluva difference.

2. A MS that doesn't get cancelled by damage...so like 90% of MS buffs? You're also talking about one of the most easily killed ADC's in the game. Few champions combine subpar range with subpar mobility at the same time.

He was talking about lane. One of the strongest adc from level 1-3 having vayne passive on steroids is scary. Not to mention how little grivenous wound matter because noone has lifesteal yet that matters.
Did you even play her once on the PBE? Her new Q is insane, chunks like 1/3 health off the enemy adc if it bounces and even more on a squishy support.

The only time it chunks like that is if it bounces off a target it killed. So if you do it off a support onto a carry and the support didn't die it does eh for damage. Bounce it off a dying creep though and hit a target and you are talking some amazing stuff.

lol, considering it is her first maxed skill as well, she can take out a minion at roughly 30-50% or more, but yeah, lol, it'd be kinda funny if that's what makes her

wait, no it wouldn't...

she would get instant nerfed because people would have to run away if there is even one dying creep around T.T

Then don't position right behind the dying creep.

Its very simple she wants you to stand behind that creep so instead stand to the right of it or farther back until you have to come in for a last hit. Potshots are a given for bot lane but thats where proper positioning comes in.

lol, once they remember how to play against the champ that is, but the thing is, you are going to suffer damage regardless of your placement when facing a miss fortune because you are almost never out of her ranged abilities

if you dodge to the side, if your partner is a thresh/blitzcrank, it can mean the end of you

if you fall back, you are missing out on both trades and creeps while she farms(her Q being about a 3 second cooldown as well)

so, I worry about MF's future...her Q is already decent burst, it's more than easy to reposition with strut adding 70 to your move speed
She has no dashes or gap closers. I'm pretty sure her having some movement speed isn't going to make her crazy OP. She's already a lane bully.

> [{quoted}](name=Ace of Eden,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-07-10T01:09:54.566+0000)
>
> She has no dashes or gap closers. I'm pretty sure her having some movement speed isn't going to make her crazy OP. She's already a lane bully.

So make her even stronger in that regard? For what trade-off?

Being the easiest ADC in the game to kill in a teamfight isn't enough of a trade-off? 

Most ADC either have mobility, range, or some sort of self-peel that actually works.

> [{quoted}](name=Ginga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-10T18:33:10.875+0000)
>
> Being the easiest ADC in the game to kill in a teamfight isn't enough of a trade-off? 
> 
> Most ADC either have mobility, range, or some sort of self-peel that actually works.

And now she has one: Activating a speed up + dropping an aoe slow.
> that actually works

> [{quoted}](name=Ginga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-10T18:56:29.241+0000)
>
> 

That's like saying Jinx's Chompers doesn't work...almost, anyway. She has more going for her when it comes to mobility in comparison to Ashe and Jinx, so her escape option isn't as strong as theirs. Actually, for Ashe, her strongest option is just shooting a slow backwards over and over and praying they don't gap close on her, yet no one's crying about that.

Not every adc needs a guaranteed escape option. If you REALLY wanna whine, go talk to Varus mains.

Jinx and Ashe have RANGE in their attacks. They don't have as much of a need for escapes because the very act of attacking doesn't put them in ****-range of the enemy champions. Not to mention, even discounting their superior ranges, they have far more effective self-peels anyways.


If you even know how to play Jinx, you would understand just how powerful as self-peel her chompers are for an ADC. Ashe has a stun. 


Varus is loaded with problems beyond his lack of mobility, but again, he has RANGE. His basic attack has far superior range in itself, but his kit also lets him contribute from safety if his basic attack is far too dangerous an option. His issues are having the worst animations in the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Hola Hello,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-10T00:57:45.460+0000)
>
> Wouldnt that make her too strong in lane? She will outrade you with the 50% attack speed and if you try to back off she will still get in some nice dps with her move speed.

How is she going to "outtrade" you with 50% attackspeed? Are you forgetting that other ADCs have far better steroids? MF doesn't even level W first  (or she's awful).

She doesn't have to level W first. It's a 50% bonus at level 1, as opposed to 20% at level one on the live servers. That extra 30% means more than grievous wounds early on when people don't have major amounts of lifesteal.

> [{quoted}](name=Sightless66,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2015-07-10T17:49:17.651+0000)
>
> She doesn't have to level W first. It's a 50% bonus at level 1, as opposed to 20% at level one on the live servers. That extra 30% means more than grievous wounds early on when people don't have major amounts of lifesteal.

Only grevious wounds has been removed on the PBE.
Her attack speed buff was reverted this PBE patch. It was 50% when I made that post. It should be noted that the 4 second CD reduction is still in place in addition to the grievous wounds removal.
Too bad they had to nerf her W for it. No more grievous wounds for any AD champs anymore.
GW needs to go anyway and have them rework healing.

Yeah, it's not like they heavily reduced the cooldown by 6 seconds and changed the AS value at level 1 from 20 to 50%...

Oh wait...

Taking all bets. They are going to change her, fix none of her problems, and forget about her for another couple of years.

Maybe then they can look if Rickless's kit is worth saving.

I disagree strongly. With strut active her move speed is astronomical. Using it in its PBE form in moments when you won't immediately lose it will give you some skill ceiling. Activating it with an immune period as you suggest would just mean whenever, wherever I want, with zero thought, I activate it to become the fastest champ in the game. Lame.

"Moments when you won't immediately lose it"

Doesn't that mean when you're not fighting someone? Wouldn't her passive be up...anyway?

When chasing (in the right moment), when (actualy) dodging, when (actualy) fleeing.
It also stays active if the damage you recive is blocked by a shield (provably bug)

Strut is still a poorly designed mechanic since any slow that damages (anything plus Rylais for example) will basically root her due to it first taking off ALL of Strut and then slow her. Strut is also keeping her back in the fact I believe she is tied with Ez and Corki for the slowest MS in the game at 325. But the former don't instantly die in ganks or to assassins without relying on flash.

> [{quoted}](name=My Waifu Chocola,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=0008000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-11T00:35:47.661+0000)
>
> Strut is still a poorly designed mechanic since any slow that damages (anything plus Rylais for example) will basically root her due to it first taking off ALL of Strut and then slow her. Strut is also keeping her back in the fact I believe she is tied with Ez and Corki for the slowest MS in the game at 325. But the former don't instantly die in ganks or to assassins without relying on flash.

Don't Jinx and Ashe also have 325? Where's their dashes and terrain hops?

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=00080000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-11T00:42:31.916+0000)
>
> Don't Jinx and Ashe also have 325? Where's their dashes and terrain hops?

both have fairly longer ranges, Ashe's 600 and her AAs and volley slow enemies; In worst case scenarios she still has her ulti. Jinx has a 525 base but maxed switcheroo brings her to 700 range in rocket mode, her snare traps got no cast time, and she has  single target crippling slow. Both can stay much safer with their kits than MF can

> [{quoted}](name=Leu07,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=000800000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-11T00:48:25.832+0000)
>
> both have fairly longer ranges, Ashe's 600 and her AAs and volley slow enemies; In worst case scenarios she still has her ulti. Jinx has a 525 base but maxed switcheroo brings her to 700 range in rocket mode, her snare traps got no cast time, and she has  single target crippling slow. Both can stay much safer with their kits than MF can

But MF's rework will now give her a more reliable mobility option. It'd be stupid for her to have Strut AND a dash/hop/blink, so they made it so you can instantly reactivate Strut while making it so shields can save Strut. So just shoot out Make it Rain, walk through it, and turn on Strut while you're on the other side of an aoe slow.

I mean, Strut eventually scales up to 70 speed. Are we denying just how much speed 70 speed is?

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=0008000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-11T02:01:40.682+0000)
>
> But MF's rework will now give her a more reliable mobility option. It'd be stupid for her to have Strut AND a dash/hop/blink, so they made it so you can instantly reactivate Strut while making it so shields can save Strut. So just shoot out Make it Rain, walk through it, and turn on Strut while you're on the other side of an aoe slow.
> 
> I mean, Strut eventually scales up to 70 speed. Are we denying just how much speed 70 speed is?

I'm not saying it wont help her at all, and I'm not asking for a dash or a blink. I know about the shield mechanic, but that means you'll either have to take barrier if there's gap closers in the enemy team AND rush BT. Shooting out make it rain in your escape path is pretty counterproductive because Make it rain roots MF for almost 0.5 seconds while she casts it. You're trying to create distance between you and the damage source that would cancel strut, Make it Rain behind you wouldn't help you do that. The usual option is to make it rain in their pathing and then activate strut, but if you're already recieving damage from any source that would break your shield the activation is meaningless.

>  I know about the shield mechanic

Yeah I'm not even sure if this is even an intended mechanic or just a glitch. It seems a little too big a thing not to mention in their preview, which leads me to believe it might just be an unintended glitch that'll get removed.

> [{quoted}](name=Ginga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=000800000000000000000000000000000002,timestamp=2015-07-11T18:45:05.814+0000)
>
> Yeah I'm not even sure if this is even an intended mechanic or just a glitch. It seems a little too big a thing not to mention in their preview, which leads me to believe it might just be an unintended glitch that'll get removed.

Strut just got changed in the PBE yesterday to note "direct damage", wich, by LoL standards, means when damage other than DoT (or ignite) hits your actual HP bar. That means that MF will need to run barrier and rush BT now; If you couple this with a Support that shields, she could have her passive up for a REALLY long time. My only concern is that, from experience, MF benefits from really aggressive, lockdown type of supports so....this narrows down the pool of champions she's effective with in the bot lane if you want to keep Strut active. The only supports that have decent shields that could go aggressive as well as peelers are Karma and Lulu from the top of my head, Thresh's lantern is so squishy it won't count in my book.

Maybe I'll have to rush Targon's and Locket to keep my babe strutting in teamfights ;-;

> [{quoted}](name=Leu07,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=00080000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-11T02:07:39.695+0000)
>
> I'm not saying it wont help her at all, and I'm not asking for a dash or a blink. I know about the shield mechanic, but that means you'll either have to take barrier if there's gap closers in the enemy team AND rush BT. Shooting out make it rain in your escape path is pretty counterproductive because Make it rain roots MF for almost 0.5 seconds while she casts it. You're trying to create distance between you and the damage source that would cancel strut, Make it Rain behind you wouldn't help you do that. The usual option is to make it rain in their pathing and then activate strut, but if you're already recieving damage from any source that would break your shield the activation is meaningless.

1) Dude, EVERY ADC hates assassins. Adcs aren't meant to beat assassins from 100-0 or feel comfortable when an assassins are around. MF isn't a special case. I mean...Vayne is and she's fking retarded, but outside of her...

2) I mean, Zap roots Jinx and Volley roots Ashe. Remember that both of them are MORE immobile than MF, even if they have more range. The point is escaping, which MF technically can do better than them, especially with the incoming changes.

3) Dropping it on them means they have less time in it if they're chasing you. Dropping it right in front of yourself means once they walk in, you out-pace them. Then you just throw on Strut and run off, never to be seen again. That's exactly how someone uses traps to escape: you don't drop it on them, but rather in front of you so they walk into it or lose time using alternate routes. This doesn't just apply to Jinx, either. I do this with Caitlyn's Yordle Trap too when I use her (although more to save other people than myself...I use the net more for myself).

> Adcs aren't meant to beat assassins from 100-0 or feel comfortable when an assassins are around

They don't. But ever notice they have the potential to escape them and survive? 


>  The point is escaping, which MF technically can do better than them

Again, Jinx's Chompers are objectively better escape tools than any slow considering it's lack of cast-time and the fact that it STOPS the enemy in their tracks rather than mildly inconvenience them. Ashe has a stun. But even if you discount those two hard CC's, their slows have superior range.


Even if you ignore their hard CC's, you're also forgetting the fact that Jinx and Ashe don't need to escape nearly as often as MF does. The difference in their effective ranges are huge. Jinx, Ashe, and Varus are capable of contributing to the team with reduced risk. That is HUGE for an ADC since safety is objectively one of the best _"stats"_ on an ADC, even more than their DPS all things considered.

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=siwrf0bf,comment-id=000800000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-11T02:19:07.869+0000)
>
> 1) Dude, EVERY ADC hates assassins. Adcs aren't meant to beat assassins from 100-0 or feel comfortable when an assassins are around. MF isn't a special case. I mean...Vayne is and she's fking retarded, but outside of her...
> 
> 2) I mean, Zap roots Jinx and Volley roots Ashe. Remember that both of them are MORE immobile than MF, even if they have more range. The point is escaping, which MF technically can do better than them, especially with the incoming changes.
> 
> 3) Dropping it on them means they have less time in it if they're chasing you. Dropping it right in front of yourself means once they walk in, you out-pace them. Then you just throw on Strut and run off, never to be seen again. That's exactly how someone uses traps to escape: you don't drop it on them, but rather in front of you so they walk into it or lose time using alternate routes. This doesn't just apply to Jinx, either. I do this with Caitlyn's Yordle Trap too when I use her (although more to save other people than myself...I use the net more for myself).

I'm not talking about assassins, I'm talking about anything with a gap closer that can sucessfully negate your Make it rain's slow field. but anyways. Jinx is extremely safe and has two self peel tools she can use before flash, Dashing through her traps still roots you, and zap's slow is crippling and hits like a truck? Make it rain's time reduction so her damage is more consistent means her slow's duration got reduced as well.

Its not a panic button like flash or corki's fire thing.
It doesnt work as an escape tool because its not.
Make her E stack Impure Shots pls.
That would completely remove the stacking mechanic of impure shots.
